alert.note: Alert for Ocean (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 11:29PM EST until December 20 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Jersey, including the following counties, in central New Jersey, Monmouth. In southern New Jersey, Ocean. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1127 PM EST, gauges reported elevated or rising river levels due to runoff from earlier rainfall. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Flooding impacts will continue, but no additional rainfall is expected. - For Manasquan at Allenwood: At 10:15pm the stage was 15.6 feet. Flood Stage is 14.5 feet. ... For N. Branch Metedeconk River at Lakewood: At 10:15pm the stage was 7.8 feet. Flood Stage is 8 feet. ... For Manasquan at Squankum: At 11:15pm the stage was 8.67 feet. Flood Stage is 8.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
